intro: Lithocardium bantamense, commonly known as the Bantam lithocardium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to the island of Java in Indonesia and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are drupes, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish pulp. Lithocardium bantamense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in its native habitat.
